author: Alanis Thames
description: Title IX, over 50 years, has heavily benefited white women over nonwhite women. That’s partly because race has never been part of the law.
title: Equity in Sports Has Focused on Gender, Not Race. So Gaps Persist.

description: Democrats meddled to boost State Senator Darren Bailey in the G.O.P. primary for Illinois governor. But efforts to elevate far-right candidates in Colorado fizzled.

author: Alexandra E. Petri
description: After Title IX passed in 1972, administrators found soccer to be a cheap way to comply. And participation rates soared in high schools, universities and at club levels for girls and women.
title: Once an ‘Easy Way Out’ for Equality, Women’s Soccer Is Now a U.S. Force
